ALBATROS 2.0. 2018 Ryder Cup Venue: Le Golf National reaches a significant milestone!
This summer, Le Golf National has embarked upon eight months of major works to renovate the Albatros course. This is another milestone reached by the golf club and the French Golf Federation who are getting ready to host the greatest worldwide golf team event in three years’ time, but not only: they are preparing the golf club to become a global reference for the next twenty-five years.
A few weeks after Bernd Wiesberger’s victory at the 99th Edition of the Alstom Open de France thanks to a brilliant closing 65, Le Golf National kicked off the Albatros course works. 90 people, 11 companies, 10,000 tonnes of sand, 100 km of pipes for potable water, fibre optics,…: here is the new everyday life of the 2018 Ryder Cup venue ranked in the Top 100 of best golf courses in the world (Golf World Magazine UK) and awarded France’s best course in 2015 (Today’s Golfer Travel UK).
After twenty-five years of good and loyal services, the Albatros shall get a fresh facelift. Le Golf National has therefore decided to upgrade the drainage system and create a natural reservoir. Lake edges are also targeted by improvements together with paths and roads as some of them will see forty ton lorries arrive in 2018. And works are running smoothly! As witness the new efficient irrigation system that has already been implemented on five holes. “The objective is to identify areas which really need to be sprinkled and to reduce by at least 30% water consumption” specifies Paul Armitage, Le Golf National General Manager. A new example that emphasizes the French Golf Federation’s choice to adopt eco-friendly practices.
As for golf course remodeling, “very little golf course design changes are being made” he adds. “Work focuses on modifying the 1st and 16th greens to give more pin positions, enlarging several tees to accommodate more players, caddies and referees, putting new sand in the bunkers […]”.
If you would like to go behind the scenes and see how such works are performed to make a course ready to host Ryder Cup matches, Le Golf National offers you the opportunity to be guided through fairways and greens, from September to November. “Our golfers are so excited that we have imagined The Ryder Cup Experience, a visit to the Albatros with ongoing work, in small groups, additionally with info about the golf course background. It can be completed by having lunch at the Club House in order to let our clients enjoy a memorable half day”.
These course upgrades are consistent with the scale of enhancements made on the other facilities this year and the creation of new services delivered to clients. The golf club’s objective: offering an outstanding and exclusive experience to all golfers, both from France and overseas. Le Golf National still has to take a further step forward for 2018 to establish the club as a worldwide reference during the next twenty-five years. Nevertheless, the club is definitely gathering momentum.
For those who cannot wait for the end of April 2016 and the championship course reopening as the Albatros 2.0, at the dawn of the 100th Edition of the French Open, “a composite course of nine holes will open in December 2015 […]” says Paul Armitage. Meanwhile, enjoy the Aigle and Oiselet courses at the best price with flexible membership programmes and the whole club’s facilities which remain open all year round.
Source:- IAGTO
